Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: israelb99
Reviews.Content: Location was great and at the old city. The hotel is really nice and the rooms are very clean. The Triumph subway station is 2 minuts walk.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back tommorrow”
Reviews.Author: LENN38
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from the Catalonia Born in March..I travelled with two small children..the location was brilliant and the little side street that the hotel was on is so quaint, I reallly felt that it captured the spanish/barcelona feel!!! The hotel is really lovely, the rooms are great and really clean with a huge bathroom!! The food is excellent and a reallly great choice for breakfast!! but what this stay memorable was the staff the where just lovely and friendly, they really cared and got to know us!!! really excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: William N
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in all respects at a great price. But what makes this hotel special is its location. The Catalonia Born is located in the Born historic section of the city, next to the Arc of Triumph subway station. El Borne (The Born) is one of the oldest and best kept sections of Barcelona. I always adored the romantic sense one gets while walking the winding narrow streets of this barrio. Near the hotel is the old Mercat del Born underneath which a major archeological discovery has taken place: ruins of the old roman city have been uncovered while a renovation project was being undertaken. The bar and restaurant scene in this part of town is superb. Specially at night.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Half Marathon”
Reviews.Author: nailparlour
Reviews.Content: Our taxi dropped us off and told us to walk.. thought ohhh dear not a good start..but only about 20 steps and the reason was the road was so narrow and only one way and was no hardship.. Hotel was spotless, the room where more than well equipped, lots of fluffy towels.. Breakfast was abs amazing and had everything you could think off... yummy yummy.. Our reason for staying for was to run the Barcelona Half Marathon and we couldnt believe our luck when we where right beside the start line.. Its a fair dander til the centre of town to las rambla but if you go right lots of cheap little bars and tapas.. well worth a try... Free wi-fi which was brill.. We had a ground floor room which was close to reception and the noise level could be quite high but once the night doors where closed this dulled it well.. The only let down was the STAFF!!! rude.. what more can i say.. they are such a let down to the hotel and its really such a pity too.. OMG!! they advertise a pool... be warned as much as the decking and chairs are v pretty and well finished.. this is NOT a pool by any imagination.. totally laughable in fact.. its no more than a bath sized paddling freezing pool.. total joke..

Reviews.Title: “great christmas break”
Reviews.Author: specialized37
Reviews.Content: good location,lovely room,quiet at night,good breakfast,helpful staff. close to las rambla and gothic quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Sim_Raskin
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, helpfull staff, Big breakfast, 2 metro stations from the center, a bit noisy from the street

Reviews.Title: “3 star(not 4!) hotel. Good value. Good location”
Reviews.Author: Ylevran
Reviews.Content: Clean room, nice area on the roof with a small pool and some tanning chairs, nice breakfast but everything tasts like margarine. Althogh the room was clean it had a strange smell,so we kept the window open and it was ok. Metro station 3 minutes from hotel door. Overall- good value for money and very convinient as a travel-base in beutiful Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eyal A
Reviews.Content: Good location not far from the center and near a Meto station. Quiet area, Rooms are spacious, in the Bathroom there's bath and also a shower. Staff nice and helpful in everything.

Reviews.Title: “Below expectations”
Reviews.Author: Piya w
Reviews.Content: We booked two double rooms through the web for the family during the trip, and stayed three nights. The location is very good. The staff are not that helpful. The room rate did not include breakfast and they charge 13 Euros for each! They charge 5 Euros for the safe deposit key. Overall - disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Pick another hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Gloria0203
Reviews.Content: We just left our stay at the Catalonia born september 8 , 2011. My husband and I did not choose this hotel. It was booked by our travel agent. We stayed there 3 nights and could not wait for our stay to be over. The staff is not friendly. Our room was so tiny and bathroom smelled like mildew. Mattress was about two inches thick. Breakfast was not good. Also the hotel is in a terrible neighborhood. There were many drug addicts and beggars. Very noisy all hours of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, though be careful of the pickpockets!”
Reviews.Author: delimak82
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite hidden in the backstreets, though is a good location being a few minutes walk from the Arc De Trioumf, and a metro station, with convenient stores next door. Hotel very clean, goodsized rooms, good variety at breakfast with large breakfast room, staff very helpful with several different maps of the city. Only negative with Barcelona I found was the pickpockets. One traveller even got their bag stolen as soon as they walked into the hotel by a woman who followed him in then ran off...passports,camera everything gone..He says the local police station is filled with tourists who had been mugged, so be careful!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Great Staff! Cozy room!”
Reviews.Author: lvs2bhyper
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a great area in the gothic quarter in Barcelona. It is very close to the Arc de Triumph and literally a 3 minute walk from the Metro and maybe a 10 minute walk to the city center. The room is not very big, though a good comfortable size. Clean bathroom. Great breakfast. We really enjoyed our stay and would come back!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: skygoddessDenver
Reviews.Content: The room and bathroom were good size for european standards. We were close to the metro - Arc de Triomphe - station. Also close to the Barri Gothic. The staff was very nice and helpful. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable, clean, great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: PJTimmy
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at Catalonia Born, and, having booked it on line, were delighted to discover we had found a great deal. It provides services comparable to a much more expensive hotel. It is in a great location. Many places are accessible on foot and the metro is close by. We loved exploring the small streets and alleys of the old city. There is a great bakery down the street and a classic small neighborhood coffee shop immediately across the street. We felt that we saw the real Barcelona. The room was very comfortable, looking out onto a narrow back alley. The staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “That was really perfect place for us to stay”
Reviews.Author: Marina_Rozenbush
Reviews.Content: It has really good location near the city center, but not "at Rambla directly", which is super in my perception. Rooms are quite cozy. The only negative point were windows, which opened at the street, and we heard whole garbage collection process every evening. Food was tasty and nourishing, good morning coffee. DON'T We arrived at the midnight and were informed that in spite of pre-paid reservation hotel is occupide and they do not have rooms for us. After few moments of shock, we were proposed to stay in another hotel of a higher grade. We agreed for replacement for one night. Taxi brought us there, and returned back next day. As far as another hotel was very comfortable, and we had chance to visit Park Guel, we were not much angry.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: blinnenkohl
Reviews.Content: My parents and I stayed there toward the beginning of April before and after we took a cruise. The location is superb, within 100 yards of the Arc de Triomf and the Metro subway. It is also very easy to walk to many major attractions from the hotel as well as hail a cab. The hotel itself is very clean and comfortable, well worth the price which is lower than many of its counterparts in the area. The rooms are nice size by European standards (be prepared, only round 110/220 volt converters will fit the outlets here). It was about 30 Euro taxi fare from the airport. There can be quite a bit of street noise on Saturday night but not enough to keep us up. Breakfast is offered in the morning for an extra charge, but there are many little patisserie type shops around (including right across the street). I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but leave in good time if you want an accurate mini bar bill”
Reviews.Author: kbarr
Reviews.Content: I am so sad not to be able to write a completely positive review about this lovely, perfectly located, clean, nicely decorated, reasonably priced hotel. However we left with a very bad taste. Firstly, several items disappeared from our room during our stay, I understand this is common for Spain and had chosen this hotel from a personal recommendation, where it was stated that this did not happen at this hotel. Finally, when we left we were presented with a mini bar bill of almost double what we had consumed. We were lucky not to be in a rush for our flight as it then took 20 minutes for the staff to go through our records and verify what I said. The problem here is that the original bill didn't include any multiples of anything from the correct bill, so the I cannot see how this was an honest mistake. This plus the painful slowness of the staff made me feel this was intentional on behalf of the hotel, as they know most people leaving do not have this length of time to wait for an ammended bill, and may not have checked the minibar prices in the first place. Also- not one for those wanting any fun on their romantic getaway. We heard a lot of noise from the bathroom next door and the corridor, so knew there was little privacy. The beds are so squeaky as to make sex a no go zone for anyone but an exhibitionist! I am not sure if I would return to this hotel, I would have to find out if there is any way barring insurance claims of getting back anything stolen by their staff before doing so.

Reviews.Title: “Appearances are deceiving....”
Reviews.Author: SpirosK81
Reviews.Content: Outside this hotel appears to be in bad condition, but inside it is a very nice and very clean hotel. It is located right next to the Arc De Triomf, so the Metro access is really 3 minutes walk away, plus it is in walking distance of many many major Barcelon sights. The staff is helpful and speaks adequate (some, even frequent) English. The rooms are quite large and the WC even larger(!!), and overall very clean. The price was also OK, considering it is in Barcelona (the most expensive city for hotels from all I have ever been to). To conclude, i was very happy with my stay there and I would choose to stay there again if I visited the city again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choise”
Reviews.Author: Dundun0101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 night during the weekend. The location is very good - rclose to evry where by foot and there is a metro right across the street. Planty of Bars, restaurants and coffee shops nearby. Located in El Born quarter which is perfect for sightseeng during the day and going out at night. A very rich Breakfast , great staff whom speaks english fluently. I'd recommand it.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business and leisure”
Reviews.Author: stulp
Reviews.Content: After first staying some other hotels, I've stayed here the last three times I was in Barcelona, and will do so on every future trip as well. This hotel has proven to be a very pragmatic place for a quick stay for conferences: it's close to the metro, as well as bus going to/from the airport. But I've also spent several days using it as a base from which to explore Barcelona with friends. It is within walking distance to all the sights, but the area is not totally overrun by tourists. Just south of this hotel, there are many small restaurants, good and bad alike. Personal favorite: the restaurant terrace on the stairs on the corner of Carrer d'En Tantarantana and Plaça de Pons i Clerch, if only for the names of the streets. There are so many alleys going criss cross around this hotel that I find a new place for food & drinks every time I visit! Explore and enjoy. The interior is nothing special and quite character-free (insider tip: go outdoors to do sightseeing) but serves its purpose. Room is clean. Sleep is good. I don't remember breakfast here, but there's a place outside on the west corner where a wonderfully grouchy weighter will serve strong coffee and 'bocadillos'. Sorry got carried away on Spanish food there again...

Reviews.Title: “Pity about Double Booking”
Reviews.Author: Irish-francophile
Reviews.Content: We had only one problem with this Hotel, hence the heading above and the low score for service. I should say that this only relates to the Manageress. As we would arrive late-10pm-at Barcelona Airport, I sent an e-mail in advance to explain this. Having got a taxi from the Airport, to ensure as much time as possible to enjoy the city centre and have a meal, you can imagine our disappointment to discover that our confirmed booking had been double booked. This is the one major error that any decent hotel should avoid at all costs. It would take up too much space and bore you to death if I were to go into all the details. We were told that there were no rooms available in Barcelona!!! However, they were able to offer a very substandard room in a group Hotel out in the suburbs. Needless to say the whole night was ruined. I asked to speak with the Manageress when we returned the following morning. This woman has no PR skills whatsoever and kept us waiting for a considerable period and without apology seemed to gloss over the matter. I suggested that we should not be charged for the night, instead she offered free breakfast for our stay. As we did not intend to have breakfast in the Hotel anyway, we rejected this offer. The matter could have been settled satisfactorily if she had even offered a reduced rate for the night. this was a great shame as we were happy with all other aspects of the Hotel. By the way, there is a lovely cafe/pattiseria opposite the front entrance. It is very pleasant and you will save yourself a lot of money.

Reviews.Title: “Great stuff and service”
Reviews.Author: omriqo
Reviews.Content: Located bear the Arc de triomf, not very central but close to it. We were impressed mainly from the responsiveness of the staff and the charming service. Room are large and comfortable, breakfast is rich. Wifi is free in the rooms. The major CON is its price, but it might be suitable for its class. Overall we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Peaches51
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a week and the location was perfect. 15 minute walk from beach,10 minute walk from Placa Catalunya and 5 minutes from the El Born area. as well as being very close to the metro. Staff very friendly and our room was cleaned every day. Two showers in our room as well! Hotel was hard to find on first night so the best way to get there is to get dropped at the arc de triomph and go through the courtyard directly to the right as you look at the front of the arc. Then go straight up the first road on the otherside of the courtyard and its just on your left.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: abnlehavim
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband and 13-year-old son for four nights. The hotel staff was friendly, but not overly helpful. The room was clean, but very small. The bed creaked and the pillows were way too thin and there was only one per person. The bathroom fixtures were old and there were some unidentifiable broken fixtures on the walls. There was both a bathtub with a shower and a stand-alone shower, but the stand-alone shower was grubby-looking and had no light, so it was pretty much useless. Note that there was only one empty wall outlet in the room, plus the two that were being used by the television and the lamp. There was a fourth outlet next to the door, but there was a long corridor between the door and the rest of the room, making that outlet basically useless if we wanted to charge a phone or use a computer. We had to unplug the television because we needed the extra outlet. Another point worth mentioning is that we needed to pay a 50 euro deposit on the room safe, plus 5 euros a day to rent the lock for the safe. However, the WiFi was free (though a bit slow). Our deal included breakfast, which was pretty good, though a bit boring -- exactly the same breakfast every morning we were there, including the same hard-boiled or fried eggs. The location of the hotel is excellent -- right on the edge of the Barri Gotic and a 10-minute walk from Placa Catalunya. That said, the hotel entrance is not on the main street and there is no parking at the hotel or anywhere nearby that we saw (we did not have a car with us and our deal also included transportation to and from the airport). The area immediately surrounding the hotel looks a bit threatening at night and although I had no trouble walking around with my husband, I'm not sure how comfortable I would have felt as a woman alone. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and there is really no reason to spend a lot of time in your hotel room when you're in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Yoav_1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, clean and big rooms (2 showers in a twin room), nice breackfast, near Barri Gotic, 6-7 minuets walk from Place de Catalonia . Also, a metro station is around the corner (Arc de traiompf)

Reviews.Title: “excellent! More than we expected...”
Reviews.Author: amitozer
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for 5 nights, after searching for a non-expsensive hotel and picked this one because of the great reviews and the location. were very very pleased with the choosing! very clean, addorable rooms, close to the main things in the city, very close to a metro (the location is so great, that we didnt use the metro so much- we enjoyed the beautiful streets in the hotel area- barrio gotic), great value for money. the staff were very nice, helped with everything we needed. even though there are great reviews about the breakfast, we didn't try it (too expensive- 13 euros).

Reviews.Title: “great accomodation in BCN”
Reviews.Author: elar84
Reviews.Content: just ruternd from there. although the room wasn't huge, and the "veiw" was to a shaft, i've enjoyed it very much; the room was comftorble (TV, minibar which we could store some food in), breakfast was great (both in terms of qualty and variety ). it is not ON THE La Rambla, but not too far to walk, and any way very accable to every city attraction (either by bus, metro or foot). just outside the hotel, there are some good, small and pleasant places to have a drink or meal. i'm not sure about value for money, just because i don't know what the price was.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, price worthy”
Reviews.Author: fistuk
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself stayed in the hotel for six nights on the first week of April, and in overall we enjoyed our stay, especially the breakfast and the location. I want to add two tips that I have not read in previous reviews: 1. There is no electric kettle or coffee maker in the room, so bring your own equipment if you wish to prepare hot tea/coffee. 2. The hotel structureis a hollow rectangular. The two short sides have rooms facing the front street and the back alley and they are noisy, even with close door/window beacause of the poor isolation. The long sides have rooms facing inwards and they are much more quiet. Obviously you should prefer the inwards facing rooms. The airconditioning operated on heating only and when we entered the room it felt stuffy so we had to open the door to refreshen the room and then we heard the outside noise

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. Does what it needs to do very well.”
Reviews.Author: pilgrim42
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet and comfortable, does everything just right for its price range. Good location, Placa de Catalunya and Las Ramblas are 15 min walk to the West. It´s in a quarter of narrow streets and local shops and restaurants. About 30 metres to the left, on the junction, there is the Reventos bar and restaurant. Warning - staff speak no English or French. Good for a beer and sandwich for lunch, also small range of tapas. Worth a visit just to see decorated wall tiles. Next to the Reventos is an internet cafe, much cheaper than the hotel. Opposite the Reventos, 10 metres on the right along the Placa de Sant Pere, there is a good restaurant called Mescladis. A little further along on the left, in the square itself, another good restaurant, La Candela. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service, would use again”
Reviews.Author: Tab_London
Reviews.Content: The Good: Great location in the heart of the old town, very good price for 3 stars, helpful staff who all speak fluent english and spacious rooms. The Bad: Nothing major but a few minor niggles. The room's window wouldn't shut properly so got cold at night but a spare blanket sorted that out and the bath tub's paint was chipped in places. The breakfast was not included and you had to pay extra - though it was a good breakfast. Only minor quibbles but definitely worth staying at for a blend of value for money, comfort and location.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: redpower
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel. Close to the Arc D Triomf and its metro. Quiet and clean. The only real criticism I can think off is that you had to pay 5 euros a day to use the safe in your hotel room. As others have stated it can be hard to find this hotel. When you leave the metro go and stand in front of the Arc D Troimf, you should have your back to traffic and be facing a long road that leads to a zoo in the distance. If you then turn 90 degrees to your right you will see Japanese restaurant (It has WOK written in big letters ) about 30 metres ahead. Walk to this restaurant. When facing the restaurant turn 90 degrees to your left and walk down the road for a few metres. You will then face a court yard with 3 sets of chairs in it. Walk straight through this court yard passing a construction site and you should then reach Rec Comtal. The hotel has flags draped outside of it. According to some you are likely to be robbed in Barcelona unless you are carrying a machine gun. I am pleased to say that if you exercise some basic caution, eg do not wave your money about, you will be safe in the area around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “hotel in a small street but has all the comfort for a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: james002
Reviews.Content: rooms very clean and the staff are well spoken and pleasant excellent breakfast with the waiter/waitresses give a tremedous service

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: HistTeacher
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of a vacation package and we were really pleased with it. Our one major issue was that it was extremely hard to find. It is easily accessible from the Arc d'Triomf metro station (costs 2.80 euros/person--from the airport, take the green shuttle to terminal 2, then metro 3 stops, transfer to track 8, then go 2 stops to Arc d'Triomf) but once you exit the station, no one seems to know where the actual street the hotel is on is! So, here's a tip for those of you taking the metro to the hotel...once you exit the metro at the Saint Joan exit, face the Arc d'Triomf (the park will be behind the Arc d'Triomf) and head to the right of the monument. You will be taking a small street (super easy to miss!) directly to the right of the monument. You have to walk through a small paved courtyard to get to the street. When you get to the small street, the hotel will be the second building on your left. The room itself was a very good size by European standards. The bed was a queen size--it was a little hard and springy, but it was comfortable enough. The pillows, on the other hand, were long and flat. They were not very good for sleeping! You could hear tons of noise from the hallway outside your room & the street below, so be prepared for that as well. There was individual heat control in the room (if you go in the winter, remember to turn the heat on or you will be very cold in your room!), as well as a desk area with a small TV. But, there was only one English channel (Bloomberg TV) which repeated the same shows & commercials over and over again. Wireless internet is free at the hotel. The bathroom was very, very nice. It was quite large & the shower was excellent. The location of the hotel was great as well. It was very easy to walk to all of the sights--Sagrada Familia, Las Ramblas...my husband & I were able to walk most of the city from our hotel. Most things were within a 15-20 minute walk, and, as earlier stated, the metro was very close by, so if you didn't want to walk, you could easily take the metro anywhere. The staff at the hotel was also very nice and they spoke English. One thing to note...the "privacy please" sign you hang on the door will only work for so long. My husband and I were only staying in the hotel for a few nights so we didn't want anyone in the room since we had electronic devices (iPod, DS, laptop computer) in our room. However, after a day and a half, the maids entered the room anyway. They didn't touch anything of ours, but they did blatantly ignore the do not disturb sign. All in all, I'd say it was a very nice hotel! I would definitely stay here again if I was traveling to Barcelona & I would recommend it to someone else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Slavabo
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located near Arc Triumph , 15 min walk from Catalonia square. Good access to metro and bus stations , they renovate this part of the street and it's not looks good especially at night. Breakfast is really good and stuff in restaurant was very helpful and friendly. The room was small even for Europe , the bath was above average level . There is a number of restaurants/cafe on this street , we visited "Hugo" (Chilean restaurant nearby) twice and were not disappointed . Need to note that this area doesn't look very safely at night , we didn't have any troubles there , probably it's just a feeling on the narrow street . In total , it's a good value for price , close to city center , however next time we will search something more close to Catalonia square.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience - however last day misinformation almost ruined the trip.”
Reviews.Author: jd1701
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a really good location. Out of the Arch de Triomf metro, turn left and head to and past the arch about a 5 minute walk to the hotel. Near the hotel are nice places for coffee and breakfast, as the 13 euro charge at the hotel is high. Also leaving the hotel with a left turn is a great Chilean place for dinner called "Hugo's". Superb quality and service. Down the same street takes you near the Catherdral and to the Ramblas. Going right out of the hotel takes you to the Arch and heading east, left at the park for a couple of blocks and then right after the park will pretty much take you to the beach between the MAPFRE and other tall building (20 minutes walk). Our room (714) was nice. Roomy, good view, good AC, comfortable beds, clean big bathroom, some english TV. Only downside was the charge for the key to use the in-room safe (5 euros per day). Maids and maid service was terrific. Young woman/girl at front desk during the day hours didn't have very good "people skills". She didn't speak nicely and seemed loathe to help. Young bearded man at front desk on afternoon of our departure (12th at 5pm) gave us wrong information on going to the airport and we ended up way off course and really stressed. Had to take a 30 taxi ride or else we would have missed our flight. Rate was okay (77+5 for safe).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: Allie89
Reviews.Content: Was very pleased with the hotel. Was great value- 75 euros for a twin room. Room was very clean, modern and had a lovely bathroom. Hotel was also in a great location; walking distance to nearly all the attractions, and a metro stop close by for ones that were not. I would definatley recommend women to not take a handbag out, mine was snatched from me in the medievel streets in the gothic quater. Luckily i managed to get it back but after that never took a bag out with me. As two young women on our own, the hotel receptionist also warned us to be careful with our bags. Mugging is a big problem in barcelona! Apart from that was really pleased with the Hotel and Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: Pvoyageuse
Reviews.Content: The hotel is within walking distance of the Palace of Calatan Music, the Cathedral and the Gothic quarter and a real bargain considering the price of other 3*** hotels in Barcelona. It is located in a very old part of Barcelona in a small street very close to the Arch fo Triumph and the subway. The surroundings might seem a bit drab but I never felt unsafe and I was traveling alone. My room was spacious, very clean and quiet and breakfast plentiful. Only problem : dim bedside lamps which made reading difficult at night. Internet access costs €2 for 10 minutes but there is a cyber cafe 20 yards down the street which charges 38 cents for 15 minutes....

Reviews.Title: “Beware of overbooking...”
Reviews.Author: txgirl77450
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Princesa only to find it was overbooked due to a "system error" and was being moved to a different hotel. Not to mention, my room was confirmed at the time of booking... what a pain in the butt. Will never book a trip there again.

Reviews.Title: “The staff were extremely efficient and helpful, especially in Reception.”
Reviews.Author: JJartist
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in Barcelona at the Catalonia Princesa Hotel, and the experience was a most pleasant one on the whole. The Breakfast Buffet was superb, albeit extremely busy, but the staff were on top of things, and the turnaround was pretty good. As mentioned, the reception staff acted professionally, efficiently and went out of their way to help, this was most appreciated. The only disappointment was the room, it was so claustrophobic facing into the middle of the building, and the lighting wasn't very good in order to read. Despite this I would recommend this hotel due to its location where everything really was within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Relatively cheap & not for away from the Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: vdany
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated near the "Triunphal Arch" in Barcelona. The street of the Hotel is a small one and its closed to transit!! (only people living in the street can travel on it), parking nearby is expensive so if you rented a car don't choose this Hotel!! The Hotel is no far away (15 minute walk) from the Ramblas and its relatively cheap although the neighbourhood is not the best (at night better to walk from "Passeig de Lluis Companys" street). The beds are small, and the rooms are not to big but on the whole we got a relatively good, clean Hotel for a cheap price (my problem was that I couldn't have 3 people in one room but eaven 3 rooms for Six people was cheaper than 2 bigger rooms for 3 people each in other Hotels) To see the exact location of the Hotel you can try - http://wiki.worldflicks.org/triumphal_arch.html

Reviews.Title: “Expected worse”
Reviews.Author: DublinSIreland
Reviews.Content: After the reviews I had read, I really expected us to be mugged or worse! However, I really have to say, in our 6 day stay at this hotel we did not so much as see one bad character! The surrouding streets are a little dark but all the little cafes are very busy until late so there are loads of people around. The hotel itself was in a good location for both Las Rambas and the beach. On our first night we found the street below to be very noisy so we were moved to a nice quite room on the second day. The rooms are quite small, but clean. The manager and staff are not very friendly but do tend to any requests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Suprise”
Reviews.Author: YY1
Reviews.Content: Having terrible experience at Barcelona airport to wait for our luggages for 2 hours, we arrived at Catalonia Princesa Hotel at very late night, around 11:30 pm. We heard many bad comments on Barcelona hotel of kicking customer out from hotel door even with advance booking, we worry our room is no longer reserved for us in such late check in. Well, yes, the hotel staff really told us that all the rooms are occupied. But appreciate their service, the hotel already reserved a room in another hotel of their group, which is a 4 star hotel located at La Ramblas area. The location of that hotel is wonderful and the rooms are big & clean. We are transferred to that hotel at hotel cost and no need to pay extra because of upgrading from 3 star to 4 star hotel. We appreciate the good arrangment of Catalonia Princesa.

Reviews.Title: “great quality low rate”
Reviews.Author: giowanni
Reviews.Content: First impression : where am I falled ? street is narrowed people ,seems not friendly . Then you acceed, and inside is quite great. We had room on 7th floor , was nice for the view on the Arc de Triomf . The narrow street takes you to the Palau de la Musica and Rambla . Many old and nice shops on this route . Definitely great quality for 100 €/night in Barcelona, no breakfast incl. This hotel values its 3 stars and I will come back again .

Reviews.Title: “clean hotel in nice location”
Reviews.Author: talesfromthecrib
Reviews.Content: this was a nice hotel with a nice location near the metro station. We did not experience any problems concerning the neighbourhood and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great City”
Reviews.Author: BeverleyRoger
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. Fully expected to be mugged at the very least! Okay, the street looks a bit dodgy (especially at night) but we had no problems. The hotel itself is very clean and modern. The bathrooms were spacious to say the least and the staff were welcoming and helpful. The buffet breakfast was fantastic-the works! Would I stay again? Absolutely! Barcelona is a huge city and two days wasn't enough time to see it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastically located, Fantastically priced!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sarahford31
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent 3 nights at the Princesa. The location is second to none. The nearest metro station is 2 minutes away and and its only a 10minute walk to the very centre of town (Placa Catalunya). The rooms were basic but very clean and comfortable. I cannot fault the staff, they were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was buffet style and although the staff were sometimes a little slow at replenishing the hot food. The was always plenty available and it was very high quality. The restaurant also does evening meals from Monday to Friday, which we had on our first night as we were so tired from travelling and sightseeing that we didn't want to venture far from the hotel. We were pleasantly suprised. Three courses was 17euros and the food was lovely even though some of the combination seemed a little strange (steak with peaches and duck with prunes). Alcohol was also very cheap a bottle of wine was 8euros and it was very drinkable!! \i would definitley recommend this hotel and if ever I go back to Barcelona (which I'm sure I will eventually) I will be staying at the Princesa. When in Barcelona I also recommend the 'Bus Turistic' you can catch it from Catalunya and it takes you round all the sights. you can get on and off as often as you want and you also get a book of discount vouchers that get you money off the admissions to all the main attractions - well worth it!!!! Other than that use the metro to get around, its really cheap and by far the quickest form of transport.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: carlo23
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here with my wife enjoying the wonderful sights and sounds of Barcelona. So much to see and take in that this was probably enough for one helping. Will definitely pay another visit - probably to the same hotel. Very conveniently situated for access to public transport, both metro and bus, and for early morning and evening strolls. Sauntering to and from the Rambla and Placa Catalunya were always fascinating. Room was adequate and service and reception staff were good. Unfortunately could not say the same for the breakfast staff who made little effort to be hospitable, although they appeared to be efficient enough. Buffet breakfast was fine but there is a big problem with renewing hotplate items, especially bacon and eggs which could take several minutes to replace. Try Com. de la Argenteria for dining.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near Arc D' Triumph”
Reviews.Author: DuchessF
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern, clean with good personnel. The breakfast is good, but not something special. The hotel is located in the area full of Arabs, Chinese, etc. And in 5 minutes from Arc D' Triumph. The metro station is near as well, but you can also walk to the places like La Rambla. Good hotel among 3*

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: getzklein
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel after reading other reviews and seeing that the lccation was right for us. We were not disappointed at all. While it wasn't plush, it was certainly comfortable. The hotel staff were polite and allowed us to check in early as we had just landed from the states and needed to clean up. I think it was about 11am and they gave us no problems. Our room was adequate, clean and just enough closet space. The beds were typical of what we found in that area, fairly hard but fine. The hotel location was ideal for us. It was a short walk to La Rambla and close to Passieg del Born which we found to be a fun little area to spend time. The park nearby was also a nice place to read a book in the afternoon. Other reviews said the hotel was hard to find, so I printed a basic map from the website and gave that to the cab driver, it seemed to help. I would recommend this hotel to others and say that the value for the price was good and we really could not have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: BigPhil40
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Catalonia Princesa Hotel for my 40th birthday. I couldn't fault anything. The staff were friendly and efficient, the rooms were clean and to a high standard and the breakfast buffet was excellent. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - not so nice neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Swede
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for four nights, sharing a triple bedroom with two friends. The hotel has quite a few positive points - vast breakfast buffet, nice staff and a very spacious bathroom. We were a bit unlucky to have a room next to the street and on the ground floor so it was a bit noisy but not too bad. It's an easy walk to most sites and you can also stroll down to the beach on Barceloneta. The metro is just 2 minutes away. The hotel's main problem is the neighbourhood. On our last night, I had my handbag snatched 50 metres from the hotel. I was walking (completely sober!) on a well-lit street full of people, holding my bag tightly. But I had no chance holding on to it when a man ran up to me, pushed me and grabbed my bag. This is of course not hotel's fault. They were actually very helpful and sympathetic when we asked for help to contact the police. BUT bearing in mind that the receptionist had several photocopies of maps pointing out the police station it was clear that robbings are common in the neighbourhood. I would not chose this hotel if you're in an all female group like we were.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in Central Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: AR&KB
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a double room at the Catalonia Princesa for four nights on a B&B basis in early August 2007. Location: The hotel is located on the edge of the historic centre of Barcelona. It is about 100 metres from the Arc De Triomf and the metro/mainline rail station of the same name. It is difficult to fault the location of this hotel as it is easily accessed by public transport and within walking distance of many of the city's key sites. However, it is far enough away from busy spots (esp. La Rambla) to get a decent night's sleep. There are plethora of bars, tapas bars and restaurants nearby and several small supermarkets to satisfy any snacking or drinking needs you might have. Rooms: The rooms are freshly decorated in modern neutral tones with dark wood furniture and a firm bed. The room has a TV (CNN and Sky News appear to be the only English language channels) and a mini-bar which can handily double up as a fridge for your own use. There is ample wardrobe and storage space. The bathroom is pretty spacious with a reasonably sized bath. Cleanliness: The rooms and public areas are kept spotless. Towels are changed daily. Breakfast: The self service breakfast buffet is excellent, with a choice of fruit, cereals, hot and cold meats, cheeses etc. plus freshly baked bread and pastries. We would definately recommend this hotel as a good value base for exploring Barcelona. We would consider this a top rate three star hotel, which is considerably better than many 4 star hotels we have used. We realise that some previous reviewers have raised concerns about the area where the hotel is located. However, I would imagine anyone familiar with sourthern European cities would not be surprised by the narrow streets, shuttered shops and unfortunately ever present grafitti in this area. We never felt unduly worried about our personal safety, even later at night, although I can't vouch for what the Barcelonans thought about us...

Reviews.Title: “very impressed with the hotel”
Reviews.Author: suziWestYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Catalonia Princesa for 3 nights at the beginning of July and were very impressed. It was rather difficult to find as it was located in a side road and the entrance opened straight onto a narrow back street.. However once inside it was very different - it had an extremely modern decor and the bedrooms and bathroom were very clean. The breakfast was exceptional and we would certainly recommend it. The hotel is situated very close to the Arc de Triomphe and a couple of lovely parks and also within walking distance of the main square - Placa de Catalunya and the Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: doon07
Reviews.Content: Have just returned home after spending 3 nights here. I had a wonderful time in Barcelona and thoroughly enjoyed staying in this hotel. I wouldn't have chosen anywhere else. If you are looking for a reliable 3* hotel with good quality accommodation, helpful staff and in a central location but away from all the hustle and bustle this is ideal. it is in walking distance to ALL attractions, and if you like walking this is perfect. it is also perfect if you want to be close to everything, but you dont want to be bang in the middle of it all. For me this was perfect was discovering the streets of barcelona, i totally loved it. La rambla - 10-15mins cathedral and gothic quarter - 5-10 mins Barceloneta BEACH - 25 mins and ignore what that woman said about feeling unsafe, I never once felt unsafe even at 1am.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: shakergrandma
Reviews.Content: When I read the reviews on trip advisor about this hotel I had my doubts about staying there, I wish I had listened to my gut and stayed somewhere else. This was one of the worst experiences ever. I travel with my husband for business several times a year and for the first time was actually concerned about my safety as I walked out the door. The neighborhood is not attractive at all, with lots of graffiti and shady lurking characters lurking about. It is near the arch and that’s about it. It is a long walk to shopping and nice restaurants. Next time we will stay closer to La Rambles. The room wasn’t too bad, the bed was as hard as a rock though, its floors were hardwood, and the bathrooms were nice size. We were told upon checking in that we had a large bed, my husband is 6’3” so this is very important to us. Well, the bed was so small, I am only 5’4” and my feet were touching the end of the bed, we were told that this was the biggest bed that they had. On our last night there, the lock to our door broke and they had to move us to a different room (by the way, they were very disgruntled about having to move us) and low and behold if it didn’t have a bigger bed! There is no iron and ironing board, and they charged us an unbelievable amount for pressing, also there is no coffee maker in the room either. Be careful, they charged us for 4 items from the minibar when we took nothing. The breakfast was very bad for the price, we walked right across the street to a little store and bought fresh croissants from a very nice lady who did not speak English but tried her hardest to be accommodating. She was very sweet. The hotel restaurant is closed on the weekend and they do have people around to help with luggage or maintenance, and act as if everything is a huge bother to them. I absolutely would not recommend this hotel to anyone! It is no more than a 2 star at best, with mean grouchy people working there.

Reviews.Title: “all in all a very good choice”
Reviews.Author: thai_feb
Reviews.Content: My wife and and I stayed in the Catalonia Princesa for 4 nights in mid April 2007. The hotel is quite nice and as mentioned before, the higher floor your room is the quieter it gets. Being in walking distance to Rambla is very positive. The rooms are also nice but as far as the buffet , even though you have plenty of choices, the service was not as expected. First day we waited for clean glasses ,second day no croissants third day no coffee for more than 10 min. And a word of warning : if you have heavy baggage I would not recommend the metro . You have to change 2 lines to get to Arc de Triomf and there are a lot of stairs and waking. I think its easier to take the Airport bus to Placa de Catalunya and then bus n. 41,42 55,141 that take you to Arc de Triomf (only 3 or 4 stops away) without sweating up and down the metro stairs. All in all I would recommend this hotel based on its position ,clean rooms and price

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, quiet, near metro station”
Reviews.Author: Belgischereiziger
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. excelent room, more than big enough for the 3 of us( 2 adults, 1 child of 7 yaers old). Bathroom has all the luxury you need. Breakfast is great and there is a lot of choice. We had dinner 1 evening, that was very tastefull and more than enough. The hotel is located in a small street, we never felt unsafe. There is a very nice restaurant in this street for Paella (Hugo) and a small tapas bar for the locals, so the real spanish atmosphere ! The hotel is very close to the metro station. The zoo is in walking distance from the hotel. The hotel staff is very helpfull, they even called the Barça stadion to ask about the public training from FC Barcelona. We enjoyed Barcelona and this hotel !!!

Reviews.Title: “Its true!”
Reviews.Author: Calle77
Reviews.Content: Partly choosing this hotel based on reviews from Tripadvisor, I can only agree: The hotel has a great location. A bit away from the Rambla (5-10 min. on foot). In a charming area with many shops and restaurants. Only a few hundred meters from Metro at Arc de Triomf. Staff is very friendly and all understand English (most of them speak it to). Rooms are quite nice for a 3-star hotel and they are clean. Breakfast buffet is amazing. Next time I visit Barcelona I will stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “deserves all its 3 stars”
Reviews.Author: zeynepsan
Reviews.Content: this 3 star hotel is nice and clean with friendly staff. deserves all three stars. we stayed here on the newyears night of 2006. it's 5 min away from bario gotico located in arc de triupho walking distance from la rambla. the street is lovely has the real barcelona feeling markets, shops old women shopping not touristy which we loved.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: petermh
Reviews.Content: This is a very comfortable hotel in an excellent location with a very extensive choice on the breakfast buffet table. the room was very reasonably priced when compared with other similar Barcelona hotels and breakfast was included in the price. The room was on the small size but this was offset by a large bathroom with a bath with shower over and a large walk in shower as well. The hotel is in walking distance of numerous restaurants and the narrow streets add to the charm of the location . I have stayed in many worse 4 * hotels

Reviews.Title: “Quiet area, uncomfortable bed.”
Reviews.Author: Lyndsey78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Catalonia Princesa for 3 nights from the 5th-8th October 06. We arrived in the afternoon by Easyjet and enjoyed the stunning view of the Costa Brava resorts and Barcelona itself whilst coming in to land. We had read on the internet that the metro from the airport was closed for repairs and would not open during our stay so we took the airport bus to Placa de Catalunya instead (journey time 20 mins) and then wheeled our suitcases to the hotel (another 15-20 mins). Later we discovered that the metro was running and we used that on our return to the airport. On arrival, we were allocated a courtyard room on the 5th floor. The room was clean, nicely decorated and quiet and we made use of the minibar on occasion but not the TV as only the news channel was available in English. My only real complaint was the bed which was exceptionally hard. My husband and I both like a firm, orthopaedic mattress but this was ridiculous. After a hard days walking round Barcelona, we wanted to come back and rest before going out for the evening but this proved impossible. After 3 days we were so tired from lack of sleep we were grateful to leave to go to our next hotel up the coast in Calella. The breakfast buffet was lovely, we tried something different every morning and there was plenty of choice from cooked bacon and sausages to pastries, fruit salads etc. There is a bar next to reception which sells a small selection of drinks, however this was never open whilst we were there, possible because of the proximity of the ground floor rooms. There is a bar across the road but we did not visit this, prefering to walk through the street and alleys to the Born area where there are many lively bars and restaurants. We did not find the local area intimidating at all, it was atmospheric and far less touristy than the Ramblas area. We also enjoyed eating in the Barceloneta area, in the seafood restaurants overlooking the marina, and drinking in the beachside bar beside the Torre de San Sebastia. We went to Placa de Catalunya to get the tour bus and decided against the Bus Turistic due to the large queue. We opted instead for the orange Barcelona Tours bus. THIS WAS A MISTAKE - apart from being more expensive, the buses are far less frequent and run round in a giant circle, meaning that to visit the sights, you must follow the order of the bus. It also stops much earlier at night as we discovered, having been stranded outside Poble Espanyol at 8pm, we watched dejected as 4 Bus Turistic's passed by and we ended up walking downhill to catch the metro. This worked out in our favour as we were able to watch the fabulous fountain display, Font Magica de Montjuic. We heard the music and saw the top of the fountain from Poble Espanyol and thought we had missed the show, not realising it goes on for hours. On leaving the hotel return, we took a taxi to Barcelona Sants (8 euros) and caught the local train to Calella. We were surprised when the train stopped at the Arc de Triomf station 5 mins from the hotel, which we thought was a metro station only. All in all, we had an excellent time in Barcelona and I can't recommend it enough. We hope to return next year but we shall try a different hotel where hopefully we will get a better sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: T&BG
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in Oct. 2006 before we went on a cruise. We booked this hotel because it was reasonably priced. The rooms were nice, clean, with a mini-bar with enough room in it to put your own water, etc. The location was good, we were able to walk everywhere and when we did take a cab to Las Ramblas, it didn't break the bank. There is a lobby bar, but there are rooms on the same floor as the bar so you have to be quiet. The breakfast is decent, but if you don't want to pay for it, you're not missing much. Definitely walk around Las Ramblas at night, but don't drink there. The drinks are very expensive and if you head 2 blocks off Las Ramblas the prices go down considerably.

HotelInfo.Name: Catalonia Born
HotelInfo.Address: Rec Comtal 16-18, 08003 Barcelona, Spain (Formerly Catalonia Princesa Hotel )
